questions.question: 1. Which of the following elements primarily cause strain aging in steels?
2. Which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. strain aging?

answers.a: Strain aging process involves precipitation of carbides
answers.b: Unloading the sample after completion of yield point phenomenon and quickly reloading it would show strain aging
answers.c: The yield point after aging is higher than the initial yield pointanswer3
answers.d: Strain aging phenomenon is due to change in crystal structure

questions.question: 3. Strain aging is more popular in:
4. Which one of the following is incorrect?

answers.a: Reappearance of yield point phenomenon is due to diffusion of interstitial atoms to core of dislocations.
answers.b: Reducing carbon content can avoid yield point phenomenon
answers.c: The upper yield point is nucleation stress of the Lüders bands.
answers.d: The strain aging effect does not depend upon the type of solute atoms

questions.question: 5. Lower yield point is not related to:
